arm_group.description:
Children who were born by elective Cesarean section after 37-38 gestational weeks.
Intervention: No intervention.
Children who were born by elective Cesarean section after 39 gestational weeks or more Intervention: No intervention.

brief_summary.textblock:
Background: It is known that after Cesarean section is correlated with respiratory
      complication more, if done after 37-38 week of gestation than if done after 39 weeks or
      more.

      Goal: The aim of the current study is to find out if these respiratory complications extend
      to later life.

      Methode: Reviewing the patients' medical file, and collecting data about respiratory
      complication.

clinical_study.brief_title: Respiratory Morbidity Among Children Who Were Born by Elective Cesarean Section After 37-38 Weeks vs. 39 Weeks and More

detailed_description.textblock:
Background: It is known that after Cesarean section is correlated with respiratory
      complication more, if done after 37-38 week of gestation than if done after 39 weeks or
      more. We have already conducted a study about this topic, and published our results.

      Goal: The aim of the current study is to find out if these respiratory complications extend
      to later life.

      Method: Reviewing the patients' medical file, and collecting data about respiratory
      complication. We will use the same patients we used at the first study. Respiratory
      complications are defined as diagnosis of asthma, treatment by inhalations or systemic
      steroids, or consultation by pulmonologist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children born in 2007-2009 our medical center by elective Cesarean section according
             to a list of IDs we have.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Children with respiratory congenital defect that was not known at the first week of
             life.

study_pop.textblock:
Children born in 2007-2009 in "Hillel Yaffe" medical center by elective Cesarean section
        according to a list of IDs we have.

clinical_study.official_title: Respiratory Morbidity Among Children Who Were Born by Elective Cesarean Section After 37-38 Weeks vs. 39 Weeks and More

overall_official.affiliation: Hillle Yaffe medical center, Hadera, Israel

primary_outcome.description: Respiratory complications are defined as any of: asthma, inhalation therapy, systemic steroids therapy, consultation by a pulmonologist

reference.citation: Nir V, Nadir E, Feldman M. Late better than early elective term Cesarean section. Acta Paediatr. 2012 Oct;101(10):1054-7. doi: 10.1111/j.1651-2227.2012.02772.x. Epub 2012 Jul 16.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
